choices: You go have breakfast while you think about it
You pass a mirror to go to the kitchen, and you notice Randy walking beside you
You go into the woods and transform
1.content:
-Anthony's point of view-

I woke up with a yawn. I just finished my first semester and Lord Fairfax Community College recently and was currently at home in the countryside, enjoying not having any school work to do. As I sat up, I noticed something black beside me, I picked it up, and couldn't believe my eyes, it was the Onyx deck.

'Wh-what the?' I thought in surprise. Suddenly the deck glowed and all of the information I needed was beamed into me. "Whoa..." Was all I could say, and who could blame me, I had just found out that an Advent Deck had chosen me to protect this world and all of the other ones from TV shows that were in danger as well, luckily I have many recorded episodes of each one. I thought about it, and realized that I needed to try to find the other Riders, where ever they were.
1.title: The beginning

choices: Use the Avent Beasts to search from above?
Take time to lay out a plan
11.content:
-Anthony's point of view-

I moved to the kitchen, taking the Onyx deck with me, and grabbed myself a bowl of cereal and some milk for breakfast. I needed some time to wake up so I could think clearly and come up with a plan to find and gather the other Riders quickly. I did not know why, but I had a strong feeling that at least one of the Rides was very close.

Then, the Onyx deck began to glow again. I knew in an instant what it meant and turned to find a number of minions entering my house through the mirrors and windows of my house. They zeroed in on the kitchen, where I was, forcing me to flee with the Onyx deck as there was not enough room to fight there.

"Let's take this outside!" I challenged.

I bolted out the back door, towards the woods to transform, when a heard a sound coming from above. I looked up and was surprised to see a giant robot vampire bat diving for my house. Just as it reached the ground, however, it suddenly transformed into a blue and silver motorcycle with a yellow silhouette of a bat on the front. It was Kamen Rider Wing Knight. I took advantage of his slightly dramatic entrance and transformed myself.

He turned to me, keeping an eye on the now hesitant minions. "I see you have the Onyx deck." he said. "I guess that makes you the leader of this team."

"Do you have a problem with that?" I asked, calmly.

Wing Knight shook his head. "Not really."

Then, the minions all attacked at once, coming in at all sides.

Working with Wing Knight, he and I fought them off. Neither he or I held back a single punch or kick. We eventually cleared the woods of all the minions. Still, I knew it was just the beginning.

"That was just the first wave." I said. "There will be more."

"What's your plan?" Wing Knight asked.
11.title: You go have breakfast while you think about it

choices: Use the decks to track down some of the other Riders
Go to the new office building
113.content:
-Eric's point of view-

Onyx decided it best to take some extra time to lay out a plan. Personally, I would have preferred to grab one of the Minions and work on getting some answers out of him. Onyx assured me that it would have been a waste of valuable time as they do not speak any Earth language. It made sense, of course, but I grumbled anyway as I reluctantly allowed the last of the few Minions that avoided us to vanish into a window. I was still angry about the other set of Minions who had trashed by house attacking me earlier.

"Those minions are the least of our worries, Wing Knight." Onyx said. "Monsters are sure to follow, and soon."

"You have a point." I said. "Let's go over our options."

We returned to the house, which I assumed was his, where we both returned to our normal forms after going into the mirror world version. Onyx seemed rather surprised by my age but he did not address the issue. He instead introduced himself as Anthony. I did the same and he quickly got me up to speed on the situation as he understood it.

"That sounds about right." I replied. "I got the same feeling when I touched the Wing Knight deck. I'm not sure why it chose me, I'm not exactly in my prime. However, I will do everything I can to help you and the other Riders stop this invasion."

I removed a bottle of pills from my jacket pocket. I opened it, then popped one of them into my mouth and swallowed it down.

"May I ask what those are for?" Anthony asked, giving a hint of concern.

"High blood pressure." I replied, returning the bottle to its pocket. "I've had it since I was a child. Without this medicine, I won't be of much use to you or the other Riders."

"Headaches?" asked Onyx.

I nodded. "Migraines, moderate to severe, but still enough to slow me down." I motioned to the table. "We should get started."

Onyx nodded in agreement and we sat down, going over ideas and suggestions.

"There is a new office building nearby my home." I said. "The entire building is one big piece of glass, perfect for the first monster to come through. It might be a good bet that the other Riders are thinking that as well."

"Hmmm. I don't think it works quite that way with the monsters." Anthony replied. "Maybe we can find a way to use the decks help find the other Riders."

"Not bad." I said. "How about we do both? On the way, we can use the deck to detect other Riders nearby. My deck sensed you as I was flying over, and yours sensed me coming."

"I still get the feeling that there is another Kamen Rider nearby..." Anthony replied. The more I talked to him, the more I sensed he knew what he was doing. After several minutes of going over our options, we both agreed on one course of action and began set our plan into motion.

What do they do?
113.title: Take time to lay out a plan

choices: They try to trap her inside of the house.
They rush out the front door to surround her.
1131.content:
-Anthony's point of view-

Eric struck me as the type of person who doesn't like to lose. Fortunately, he was mature enough to listen to my reasoning and agreed that using the decks to locate the other Riders was the best course of action. Together, we focused and searched for any nearby deck, we quickly found that there was one nearby, in fact, it seemed to be inside the normal world version of my house.

"There's another Kamen Rider this close?" Eric wondered out loud in shock.

"There's only one person still in our world's version of this house, it has to be her." I said as I went to the mirror.

"Her?" Eric asked in confusion, but I was already on the other side by that point. He soon appeared behind me after I began heading to my sister's room. "Who are you talking about?"

"My little sister." I replied as I opened the door to her room. She was sitting on her bed looking at the Siren Deck in confusion.

"Scottie, do you know what this is?" She asked, using my family's nickname for me.

"Scottie?" Eric asked, confused.

"Family nickname." I simply replied. I could tell that he was currious why my nickname is Scottie, but he was willing to wait.

"Who's that, and why is he in the house?" Christina asked in surprise, obviously wondering why a stranger was in the house. After an introduction and a long explanation (along with a demonstration she was skeptical at first), she was helping us search. As the minutes passed, I watched Eric slowly pace the living room floor, keeping a sharp eye on the windows and mirrors.

"You really should relax." I told him, slightly irritated by his pacing. "It's not good for you to be this wound up."

"We have no guarantee that the decks will warn us of in coming trouble while we are searching for other Riders." Eric replied flatly. "We must be vigilant."

"Point." I said. "However-"

"-I think can we do it without pacing." Christina finished, already knowing basically what I was going to say.

Eric stopped, realizing that he was indeed pacing. "Sorry. I've been in a few situations, in my time, where I was forced to defend myself in near total darkness. I had no idea where my attacker was going to come at me next. Those minions remind me of those times."

I gave a low sigh, but we nodded in understanding and decided to change the subject.

"With all of us searching, we should find another Rider very soon." I told him.

"Yes." Eric. "But that same Rider could be an enemy. I'm not trying to be pessimistic, just realistic." He turned to me, serious. "In my experience, nothing nothing can be taken for granted, we must stay alert."

I nodded. He had a valid point.

Then, we heard the roar of a motorcycle outside as we sensed a Rider nearby. I looked out and found a beautiful young woman in a dark blue skin tight bodysuit with heels dismounting off of a white motorcycle. She was a little shorter than me, with long, dark brown hair and dark brown eyes. As she walked towards the kitchen door, I took a step closer to investigate. But Eric quickly rose his arm to block my path.

I turned to him, annoyed but stopped as I saw a certain deep focus in his eyes.

"What is it?" I asked him.

"Look at our decks." He said quietly, watching the girl slowly approach the house.

I brought my deck to eye level, as he showed his and Christina looked at hers, and we found that all of our decks were flashing in a familiar way, warning us of danger. Who ever was coming to the door, she was not an ally!

We quickly grabbed our decks got ready to transform.

"I know this house like the back of my hand." I said. "If we work together, we might be able to trap her."

"Bad idea." Eric warned. "It could be very hard to fight in such a small space. We have to take this outside. If we go out the front and circle around, we might be able to catch her off guard and surround her. Still, it's your call."

There was no time for discussion. I had to decide fast!

What happens next?
1131.title: Use the decks to find some of the other Riders

choices: They return to the house to find Robert there
Their decks warn of danger again
11312.content:
-Eric's point of view.-

I was very surprised, and concerned, that two members of one family were selected to become Kamen Riders. If one or the other were to fall in combat... I shivered at the thought and decided to do everything I could to prevent that from ever happening.

"Eric!" Came Anthony's hushed voice, pulling me to the present. "Focus! My sister and I will go right. You will go left. If we're lucky, we can all surround her at once."

I nodded and we all rushed out the front door, single file, transforming as we went. I banked left and ran through the side yard, trying to control my pace, despite my excitement. Our timing was perfect, we all converged upon the back yard at the same time to take the unknown girl by surprise, only to find that she was not there and her white motorcycle was gone.

"She was just here!" Christina said, surprised.

Surprised myself, I conducted a quick search of the yard. There were no signs of tire tracks, no smell of exhaust in the air, no foot prints in the grass, other than our own. It did not make any sense, it was as if she was never there. Then, as I took a step back towards the house, I caught a reflection of light from the large kitchen window, shining on the ground. That was when it dawned on me.

"She was never here!" I said outloud.

"Explain." Anthony said, turning to me.

I pointed to the refection of light on the grass. "She's using the mirror world to search for Riders." I said. "She most likely detected our decks while we were searching ourselves, and stopped at the window to investigate."

"Then the reflection of light on the grass created a sort of holographic effect?" Christina asked, doubtful.

"It seems a little far fetched but as good as any other explanation." Anthony replied. "Still, it raises a lot questions. Who was she and why is she looking for other Riders?"

"Do you think she's on our side?" Christina asked.

"Considering that our decks reacted like they did, I doubt it." Anthony responded. "But we can't be sure, and we have to find the other Riders."

-normal point of view-

No one noticed that in the reflection of one of the cars' windows was the girl, looking at them, biding her time.

What happens next.
11312.title: They rush out the front door to surround her.

choices: Anthony and Eric go into the show alone
113121.content:
-Christina's point of view.-

I wasn't too sure about Eric. He seemed like a good enough person, just a little annoying. Still, whenever I caught a glimpse of his eyes, I could tell that he was holding something back, something painful.

"There's nothing more we can do here." My brother said. "I suggest we go back inside and continue our search."

Eric and I agreed and we started walking towards the house. I purposely walked slowly, allowing Eric to move ahead, as I talked with my brother.

"What do you make of him?" I asked, quietly.

"He's a little annoying." He whispered. "But I believe he means well. He has this look in his eye that tells me he's lost more than just a few friends."

"Which makes him want to protect any new friends that much more." I finished.

Scottie nodded. "Exactly. I think, once he sees that we can handle ourselves, he will loosen up a little and become more tolerable."

Then, my brother and I heard a loud commotion in the house. We ran through the kitchen door to find a comical scene. Eric was back in his civilian form, struggling to throw off my best friend, Robert. Robert was clinging to Eric's back, repeatedly hitting him on the head and shoulders.

"Who are you!?!" He demanded, bringing his fist down. "What are you doing in my friends' house!?!"

"Ow!" Eric complained. "Get off of me, kid, and I'll tell you!"

"Not a chance!" Robert yelled. "Explain yourself or get out!"

Scottie and I could not help but laugh at the scene. Unfortunately, it distracted Robert. Eric took advantage of the distraction and caught his right arm. With a powerful heave, he pulled Robbert off of his back, landing him hard but safely onto his feet.

"You got spunk, kid!" Eric told him. "I'll give you that!"

Robert rose his hands as if to defend himself and I yelled to him to stop.

"Easy, Robbie!" I said, hurrying towards him. "He's okay."

"You know this guy?" Robert asked, surprised.

I walked up to him and noticed another Advent Deck hanging out of the side pocket of his jeans. That was when I showed him my Siren deck.

"He's a Kamen Rider, like you, me, and Anthony." I explained.

Robert looked at Eric, surprised, then blushed, embarrassed, as Eric showed him his Wing Knight Deck.

"Oh, man!" Robert said. "I... I'm sorry. I didn't know."

Eric rubbed the back of his head, as if to massage away the pain. I could tell he was highly frustrated with my friend. I was sure he was going to blow up on him, but, to my surprise, he let out a low sigh then smiled.

"Forget about it." He replied. "I would have done the same thing in your place." He gave out a short laugh. "I have to admit, I never saw you coming."

Minutes later, we all gathered in the living room as Robert told a familiar tale of how the deck, which my brother and Eric called the Thrust Deck, came to him and he was attacked by a number of Minions. My brother and Eric explained their own experiences, which was when a thought came to my mind.

"Did any of you ever wonder how the Minions detected us so quickly?" I asked. Eric turned to me, raising his eyebrows in surprise. I could tell that he had wondered that himself.

"Right now, we can only guess." My brother said. "But we have other things to worry about. We were given these decks, these powers for a reason."

"I'm afraid we are going to discover that reason all too soon." I added.

Scottie nodded, then looked at the clock. "It's getting close to lunch." he turned to Robert and Eric. "Care to join us?"

Before anyone could answer, the sound of thunder from a TV show was heard from my brother's room.

"You didn't happen to turn my TV on and forget to turn it off, did you Robbie?" My brother asked, turning to my friend, who shook his head in response. We ran into his room and saw that it was on the first season of Power Rangers (which my brother said shouldn't even be playing now), and that a wierd storm was quickly forming in it. We saw a fearful shadow appear from the clouds and begin to descend slowly.

"What's that?" Robert asked.

"I don't know, that wasn't in the series, so you can bet it's something we need to take care of." My brother said.

What happens next?
113121.title: They return to the house to find Robert there

choices: He asks Anna to help fight the monster
1131211.content:
-Anthony's point of view-

Eric and I both transformed and entered the show through the television screen together. Once on the other side, we were immediately aware that something was not right. They looked skyward at the descending shadow to find something that resembled the image of a nightmare. It was a giant beetle made up of literally millions of insects.

"What in the name of heaven is that!?!" Eric asked, taking a small step back.

"I have no idea." I replied, staring up at the monster.

Then, a thunderous boom was heard and we both turned to find Jason's Red Dragon Thunder Zord moving in to face the monster with the other Zords following close behind. I sensed that the monster was ready for them and, apparently, so did Eric.

"They are going to need some help battling that over sized bug." He said. "I'm moving in!"

I tried to caution him not to act too hastily but he had already summoned his Advent Beast and was flying off to take on the monster. I let out a low sigh and shook my head.

'Some people just have to learn things the hard way.' I thought.

Then, my deck suddenly flashed in a familiar way. It had detected another Rider somewhere close. I looked about and was surprised to find a young woman with shoulder length hair standing directly between the Power Rangers' Thunder Zords and the monster. Instinctively, I materialized my motorcycle and raced out to pull her to safety.

As I steadily got closer, I saw that she was wearing a black, short sleeved shirt and a black skirt. I could make out a pair of black shorts underneath. She had black elbow length gloves, black knee-length boots with heels, and a headband very much like my own.

Then, as the Zords clashed with the monster, with Eric assisting, the girl reached for what was unmistakably an Advent Deck and transformed. Her armor was identical to my own, only more feminine, complete with a skirt.

"Who is she?" I wondered out loud.

At first, I thought of the girl the others and I saw in the window but, for some reason I couldn't figure out, I seriously doubted it was her. I quickly shook the thought from my mind and increased speed. I reached her within seconds. I was about to yell to her to get on only she did so on her own accord.

"Th... Thank you, Anthony." She said.

"What? How do you know my name?" I asked.

"I'm Anna." She stated. "I think we'll just get in their way if we stay right here."

I nodded then sped away from the battle, only to get the girl, Anna, to a safe distance as she did not seem to be all together at the time, all the while wondering how she knew my name. However, the monster had other plans. A large piece of it broke away and flew towards me in the form of a wasp the size of a city bus!

"It looks we have no choice but to fight." Anna said.

I looked up at Wing Knight, concerned, but found that he was surprisingly holding his own for the moment. I knew these kinds of series well enough to take on the monster, but I was not sure about Anna. The monster was closing in fast, I had to make a quick decision.

What does Anthony do?
1131211.title: Anthony and Eric go into the show alone

choices: Anthony and Eric speak with the Rangers.
11312112.content:
-Anthony's point of view.-

Although Anna had armor identical to my own, I was not completely certain about her state of mind. Asking her to help me fight the monster would not have been wise. I decided it best to fight it alone. I took another glance at Wing Knight and was surprised to find him using his Gust Vent attack to push a large number of the insects aside. Then, for some strange reason, he leaped from his Advent Beast, into the heart of the swarm.

What is he up to?" I wondered.

Then, I caught a brief glimpse of some creature standing in the center of the swarm. It hit Wing Knight with some kind weapon, throwing him out of the swarm like a rag doll. Wing Knight seemed shaken but he was far from out, the battle continued.

"So that's it." I thought. "It must be a new creation of Lord Zedd & Rita Repulsa."

I immediately turned back to the smaller swarm coming for me and inserted a card.

"Survive Mode!" My armor changed into Survive Mode. and I slotted my Strange Vent into the Black Drag Visor-Zwei.

"Strange Vent!" The Visor said as the Strange Vent card was replaced by the Gust Vent card, which I immediately slotted. "Gust Vent!"

Dragblazer appeared, then opened his mouth and blew, creating a small tornado temporarily scattering the metallic insects, as well as injuring and/or destroying some, leaving a small creature in the center vulnerable.

"Hi there." I said, in a sarcastic tone.

The monster gave a growl as I aimed the Black Drag Visor Zwei at it and began firing. It howled then seemingly exploded, with the many mechanical insects following.

"That's one down." I said to myself. "Now for the other."

"That was awesome!" Anna said, amazed.

Then, I heard, "Gust Vent!" After that I heard "Shoot Vent."

I looked up to find Wing Knight attacking again, only this time, he was using his head. He used his Gust Vent to scatter the insects, as before, then used his Shoot Vent to blast the creature away from the swarm, and right into range for Jason's attack. His Zord, in robot mode, was ready. He brought its sword down upon the creature as it reached him and it was over. The creature exploded and vanished, with the mechanical insects vanishing with it.

"You friend is rather impulsive." She said, watching.

I remained silent, even though I had the same thought in mind. "He's a stubborn one." I thought. "He's a good man but with that high blood pressure of his..." I let out a low sigh. "He's going to push himself too far and get hurt when we need him the most unless I straighten him out."

Then, Wing Knight came down from the sky, his Advent Beast returning to where it came. I was tempted to confront him on the spot, telling him how dangerous it was for him to push himself as he did. Only, that was not the time. The Power Rangers were coming down as well.

What happens next.
11312112.title: He fights the monster alone

choices: Keep that info to himself for now.
113121122.content:
-Anthony's point of view.-

Eric and I walked back into the living room, through the television, with Anna close behind. My sister and Robbery ran up to us, concerned and immediately noticed Anna.

"Who's your new friend?" Robbert asked. After a short introduction and a detailed explanation of what had happened, Robbert nodded.

"Sounds like it was tough." Christina said.

Then, I was Eric quietly excuse himself and walk into the next room. He had that same 'hurt' look in his eyes. I decided I had better talk to him now. If anything, to get to the bottom of his reckless behavior.

When I entered the next room, I found him staring at an old photograph, his eyes were swelling with tears.

"Eric, we need to have a talk." I told him.

Eric sighed. "Have you ever lost a close friend?" He asked, quietly, staring at the photograph. "I lost twelve friends in one night, I was sixteen at the time."

I knew this was coming sooner or later but as I saw the 'hurt' in his eyes, I decided that the time was not right to get into an argument so I instead decided to be a leader and offer council.

"Do you feel like talking about it?" I asked him.

Eric turned to me, a single tear escaping his eye. "You were not the first person entrusted with the power and responsibility of the Onyx Deck."

To say that I was not shocked would have been a lie, although it felt like something was telling me that it wasn't true, and I mean that quite literally. Eric handed me the old photograph and I saw all of the Kamen Riders standing, side by side with their motorcycles. Only, there was clearly different people behind the armors. I turned to Eric, throwing him a questioning look, to which he shook his head.

"No, I was not the bearer of the Onyx Deck." he said. "I was as I am today, Wing Knight." He fought off a few frustrated tears. "Earlier, I told you that I did not know why the Wing Deck chose me. I did not mention that it had chosen me a second time."

"What happened the first time around?" I asked him, trying to make sense of what was going on. Eric paused, reluctant. I could see his lips trembling slightly before he turned from me. I took his shoulder and spun him back around. "Talk to me, Eric." I demanded. "What happened?"

Eric sighed in surrender. "We were so certain we had the entire problem figured out." He said. "There was a tear in the reality stream, a barrier that exists between imagination and reality. It was allowing all worlds it touched to collide, mix, and merge. We all knew that if that tear got much larger, it would be the end of everything we knew." I was stunned as it almost made everything that was happening now make more sense. But there were pieces in what Eric said that did not quite fit so I pressed for more of his story.

"It turned out that someone or some group was manipulating that tear with some advanced machine, causing specific worlds to collide." Eric said, continuing. "Todd, the bearer of the Onyx Deck at that time, was a great leader, he kept us together and we were able to find the machine." He paused, wiping away a few more frustrated tears. I could tell that he had been holding this in for all these years. It must have been very difficult for him to talk about.

"Eric, I need to know what happened." I pressed.

"A fight ensued between us and just about every minion from the television action shows at that time." Eric said. "They were trying all they could to keep us from the machine. Todd rushed in but I hesitated and turned from him as I sensed that Chris, Todd's little sister and the bearer of the Siren Deck was in trouble." He swallowed down a hard lump. "In that one second of hesitation, the machine exploded and everyone, everyone vanished completely. I never saw them again."

I could not help tear a little to Eric's story but I did well to hide them for, as a leader, I had to remain strong. I placed a hand on Eric's shoulder in an effort to give comfort but he grabbed my hand before I could get there.

"This is my burden to bear, Anthony." He told me. "Never knowing what happened or if there was something you could have done. I will be DAMNED if I lose anyone time around." With that, he released me and walked away.

Note, the next part was written by Starfighter364 to make this chapter work, otherwise it would have had to go down.

I stood there thinking about what I had been told, trying to make sense of it, because many things didn't add up.

'What's going on? If the decks really chose riders before, then there should be no way they'd bond with us, considering the whole DNA lock thing, and even if they did, Eric shouldn't have had to receive his again, it should have remained with him.' I thought. 'Also, the knowledge I got from the Onyx deck tells me that there is no way they should have been around long enough to pick another set of riders anyway, and that there is no tear in reality, it is just the power of the mirror monsters going into other worlds, and what is with this voice I've been hearing since the start of Eric's story? Am I going mad?'

'No, you are not.' A deep and powerful voice spoke to my mind (if you could truly call it a voice since, as I said, it was in my mind). It was the same voice that had been talking to me during the story!

'W-who are you?' I think to it in shock.

'Look in a mirror and you'll see...' The voice replied. I turned to a nearby mirror and jumped back slightly in shock, staring at me was Dragblacker.

'Dragblacker?' I thought in surprise.

'Yes, my rider, it is I.' Dragblacker thought back.

'What the heck is going on?' I asked through my thoughts.

'Unlike the Advent Beasts in the shows, we can talk to our riders because of the mental link we form with them.' Dragblacker replied.

'Why didn't you do so before?' I asked through my thoughts.

'Just because we can talk doesn't make us chatterboxes.' Dragblacker thought with some humor in his "voice," so to speak. 'We mostly keep to ourselves unless someone speaks to us first, but I have something to tell you.'

'What is it?' I asked Dragblacker through my thoughts.

'This is actually a message from Blackwing, someone intercepted and messed with the Wing Knight deck, and that effected the deck's chosen one, making him think that he was the only survivor of a previous group of riders, even though the rider powers didn't exist then.' Dragblacker replied.

'Three questions: one, how come Blackwing isn't saying this to Eric, two, where did the picture come from, and three, why did they make him think that instead of trying to brainwash him or something?' I asked through my thoughts

'In that order, something is keeping them from being able to speak, and Eric doesn't know that riders and their Advent Beasts can speak telepathically, the picture was materiallized in Eric's room by the same people who messed with the deck, my guess is they did that to help make it seem like that really happened, and finally, I think it is to give him survivor's gilt, since the Wing Knight power is one of the best, considering Survive Mode, and they didn't have time to do something that would mess with his mind to a brainwashing degree since the deck was still trying to get to its rider, and they knew they couldn't stop it for long, however, implanting fake memories is much easier, so they could do it fast enough.'

'Man, Eric, needs to know this, but there's no way he would believe me, and I don't want to distance him from the group by putting him on the spot.' I thought to myself, forgetting momentarilly that I now have a dragon telepathically connected to me, and that he could listen to my thoughts.

'That is correct, my rider.' Dragblacker replied, surprising me a little. 'I knew that I made the right decision choosing you as my rider.'

'This will take some getting used to.' I thought, not bothering to go deeper into that thought since I was sure he already knew. I needed to figure out whether to tell the other riders, minus Eric, or not.
113121122.title: Eric's Burden?

1131211221.content:
-Anthony's point of view.-

I decided it best to let everyone know the situation as I felt I could use all the input I could get to solve the problem it created around Eric. Only, I could not afford Eric to hear. Fortunately, he had left the house and was speeding off somewhere on his motorcycle. To cool off, I hoped.

'What could anyone hope to accomplish by pushing him over the edge like this?' I wondered. I gathered everyone together and explained the situation. Once I was finished, Christina closed her eyes, let out a sigh, then opened them.

"No wonder he kept so close." She said. "But why this elaborate scheme?"

"I have an idea." I replied. "Eric has high blood pressure. From what I understand, he had it since he was a child. If that's actually true, his heart must be under a lot of wear and stress. With those false memories driving him to always jump into every confrontation, without hesitation..."

"... he'll eventually drive himself to a heart attack." Robbert finished. He sighed, worried for Eric. "Did you tell him?"

"He'll never believe me." I replied. "As far as he knows, he's been carrying this survivor's guilt with him for over twenty years... He believes he has been given a second chance to make things right."

"Which will make him very determined to push himself to his limits." Anna said, musing. "He does not wish to lose anyone a second time."

"Where is Eric?" Christina asked, looking around.

"He left a few minutes ago, on his bike." I replied. "I'm hoping he's going somewhere to cool off."

There was silence for a moment, and then Anna looked to me suddenly after a thought came to my mind. "What if he's going to visit where this false battle took place?" She asked. I turned to Anna, startled, as that was the exact thought that had just crossed my mind a moment ago.

"What makes you think that?" I asked, wanting to hear her reasons.

Anna paused. "If I believed that happened, I would often visit the last place I saw my friends." She said. "If nothing else, to visit their grave, so to speak." Now I was a little spooked, because that is what I had just been thinking.

"I was just thinking that same thing." I said, but not mentioning that she seemed to know exactly what I've been thinking since I met her. "But we need to figure out how to track him down."

'I can help with that, my rider.' Dragblacker thought to me. Anna I looked towards the reflective surface of the TV to see him floating there. 'He stopped about ten miles from here.'

"How do you know that?" Anna asked, suprising me both because she said what I was thinking again, and the fact that she could hear Dragblacker. Christina and Robbert turned in the direction we were looking as soon as she spoke.

"Wait, you heard that dragon?" Robbert asked.

"Yes, why do you ask?" Anna asked.

"Robbert and I didn't hear anything..." Christina replied. We quickly explained what Dragblacker said.

"Let's go see what's he's up to." Robbert said, heading towards the door.

"No, Robbert!" I warned him. "If he sees us all there, he might lose all trust in the team. I will go alone."

With that, I rushed over to my motorcycle and raced after him.
1131211221.title: Know thy enemy.

11312112211.content:
-Eric's point of view.-

I rode my motorcycle out to the site I had last seen my lost team. Fortunately, the warehouse was not very far from Anthony's house. Stopping at the entrance, I let out a low sigh, hearing the sounds of that last battle echoing inside my mind. Allowing myself a bitter tear, I drew a deep breath and dismounted.

"It felt good to get the truth off my chest." I thought. "Even if Anthony decides not to believe it." I frowned. "Who can blame him? To hear that you were not the first to have such power can be disheartening to anyone."

I turned to my bike. "Wait here, old friend." I said, referring to Blackwing. "I shouldn't be too long."

Walking into the warehouse, the sounds of my last battle to save the world grew stronger, I could see the events as they had unfolded over twenty years ago. I shivered a little as I stopped in the center of the junk ridden building and let out a longing sigh.

"Where did you guys vanish to?" I asked out loud.

Then, I heard a dark, almost mechanical, sinister laugh, echoing from the shadows. I wipped around to see a red light slowly moving back and forth in a short line in the darkness. My eyes widened slightly as I recognized the moving light as the sensor on the black trans am, named KITT from the action series, Knight Rider.

"KITT?" I asked, surprised.

Again, the voice laughed again. "Guess again, Wing Knight!" it said.

My eyes narrowed with hate as I then said, "KARR!"

The black trans am rolled forward on its own as KARR's voice laughed yet again. "Come to visit the shadows of your past, are we?" It asked. "You will NEVER find your friends, give it up!"

"I can only assume that your arrival, after all this time, means that those maniacs have reopened the tear in the reality stream." I told him. "Where is the machine, KARR!?!"

"Do you seriously expect me to tell you?" asked KARR, sounding amused. "I'm here to give you a chance."

I turned to KARR, curious. "A chance?" i asked, not trusting him.

"I will tell you everything... If you can defeat me."

I smiled, sensing a sucker bet. "You're either out of your circuit powered brain, thinking you can beat me." I said. "Or you have something planned."

"Do you accept my challenge, or not!?!" KARR asked impatiently. "Or have you gone soft in your old age?"

That comment made me angry and I transformed. "BRING IT ON!!" I roared.

Then, to my shock and horror, KARR 'transformed' before my eyes into a massive robot and laughed at me.

"This is one of the benefits of when worlds collide!" he told me. "Even cartoons, such as the Transformers have a reality all their own!" he laughed again. "Let's, as you said, BRING IN ON!!"

'Me and my big mouth!' I thought.

I dodged KARR's first blow and inserted a card. "Sword Vent!"

-Anthony's point of view-

I arrived at a clearing and found Eric's bike standing nearby. I looked about then heard the sounds of a fierce battle occurring close by. I quickly transformed and rushed towards the sound, believing that Eric was in need of help, only to find him fiercely fighting against... no one!

'What is he doing!?!' I wondered.

Then, I thought about what Dragblacker had told me of his false memories and figured that he must have believed that he was seeing an old enemy and was trying to force answers out of him in a battle... inside his mind.

As the battle was not real, I watched Eric, as Wing Knight, be thrown across the length of the warehouse as if he were a mere toy, only to get up and charge again, determined.

"Who or whatever he's fighting, it's damaging him physically as well as mentally." I thought. "I HAVE to stop him, somehow before he literally kills himself!

'I have a suggestion, my rider.' Came the voice of Dragblacker.

'I'm listening.' I thought.
11312112211.title: Shadows of a false past.

113121122111.content:
-Anthony's point of view.-

'Eric told you that in a one second hesitation, the 'machine' exploded and everyone vanished.' Dragblacker said. 'However, before that, he said that he had turned away from his leader, sensing another 'rider' was in danger.'

I immediately caught on to what Dragblacker was trying to say. "He suggested a distraction, then spoke of a hesitation." I said, thoughtful. "A contradiction. He was trying to send me a message, at least subconsciously."

'The false memories have created an alternate personality within Eric.' Dragblacker told me. 'Both Blackwing and I sense that his true personality is fighting to regain control.'

"Then I better better help with that fight." I said, charging forward.

'Good luck to you, my rider.' Dragblacker said, before becoming silent once more.

I came close to the 'battle' but, because I could not see who Eric thought he was fighting, it was difficult to find the right moment to jump in. Then, Eric stopped, breathing heavily and I heard him speak.

"Your armor is trashed, KARR!" He said, obviously hiding his own pain. "Another few blows and you will have to be towed back to your own reality! WHERE IS THE MACHINE!?!"

At this point, I guessed that Eric was winning his 'fight' and I decided it was the perfect time for a distraction.

"Eric!" I yelled, trying to sound urgent. "BEHIND YOU!!"

Eric spun around, startled then suddenly looked about, confused, before letting out a near primal scream of anger and he fell to his knees, driving his sword into the hard ground. He took a few deep breaths, then returned to his civilian form, the sword vanishing.

"Not again!" He fumed. "I was so close to getting that bucket of bolts to talk!"

He turned to me, frustrated as I returned to my civilian form as well. However, he did not seem angry, he seemed more curious. "What did you see behind me before everything vanished?" He asked me.

"A shadow." I lied, something that I really hated to do. "That's all I was able to see."

Eric nodded, slowly rising to his feet. "I sensed something was behind me." He told me. "I also heard a low, powerful voice, somewhere close." He paused, still curious. "It said 'my rider.' nothing else."

I paused myself, knowing that it was Blackwing, trying to get through to his mind and realized that it came close to making contact. I sighed, wondering weather or not I should try to reach him myself or if I should wait and see if his true personality prevails.

"You seem to have a lot on your mind." said Eric, turning to me. "You got me to open up, now it's my turn, what's troubling your mind?"
113121122111.title: Fighting inside.

1131211221111.content:
-Anthony's point of view.-

"You're being play for a fool, Eric." getting straight to the point, I said. "False memories had been implanted into your mind, via the deck you received. This fantasy is clouding your real memories."

For a moment, Eric looked at me as if I had lost my mind. Then, to my relief, he said, "If what you say is true, it would explain a lot."

"What do you mean?" curious, I asked.

"I can't seem to access any of my combat cards except for the Sword Vent." looking at me, Eric said. "If there is a force effecting the deck, it would explain why I can not use it to its fullest." he sighed. "Any suggestions?"

"First, I'd ignore any thoughts of you once being a part of some lost team." seriously, I said. "Those memories, false or not, are distracting you from what must be done." sighing, I added. "We need you to stay focused, Eric."

"What of my deck?" worried, Eric asked. "I'm not much good if I can't use all the cards."

"We'll work on that." seriously, I replied. "Maybe, its these false self doubts that are hindering you."

Eric paused, I could tell he was taking my words seriously. "Alright, we'll play this your way." finally, he said. "I'll do what I can to focus only on the here and now, see where it gets me."

"I recommend you practice hard to help yourself stay focused." mounting my motorcycle, I said. "Also, try to remember that we are a team so no more solo heroics unless its necessary."

"Fair enough." mounting his motorcycle, Eric replied. "Let's get back so we can get started."

I rode away from the clearing with Eric following, feeling better knowing that Eric was closer to being his true self, whatever that might be...
1131211221111.title: Talk to Eric.

choices: They all begin talking about how they got their decks
Another rider rides in on a motorcycle
They decide to talk in a public restaurant or one of their homes to regroup
114.content:
----Normal point of view------

Just as they started to formulate their plan, several Worms surrounded them growling and rumbling in their language.

------Anthony's point of View------

I looked around and saw what was unfolding before me "This can't be real" I said pulling out a card and sliding it in the visor "Sword Vent!" It said and my sword fell to my hand.

"Sword Vent!" I heard as Eric's lance came to him as we made our way to them. We started making our approached attack the Worms sensed they were weaker and progressed more until they started fanning us out to divide us "Final Vent!" Is all I heard as I saw Eric jump in the air and Black Wing was on his back as his cape.

"Good idea Eric." I said, slotting my Final Vent in as well.

"Final Vent!" Dragblacker appeared and circled around me before rising slightly. I rose into the air as Dragblacker sent me forward, legs first in a kicking position as Dragblacker paralyzed them and I kicked all of my section as Eric came down like a drill on his section.

"Damn it, we barely dented them!" Eric said, seeing them.

"What do we do..." I began, before I heard another Visor speak.

"Shoot Vent!" A blast hit and destroyed a large number of the enemies.

"Strike one!" I heard a voice say as Kamen Rider Torque, who arrived seemingly out of nowhere with a cannon in his arms said.

"Who the heck is he?" I wondered out loud as he fired at the monsters again.

"Strike two!" He said pulling out a card. "Ooh, and strike three, you're out!" He said pulling out a card. "I suggest you get out of the way." He said to Eric and me.

"Eric, do as he says!" I said, already having an idea of what card he pulled out. We got behind him and he slotted the card in his Magna Visor.

"Final Vent" Is all it said as Magnugiga came up. Torque put his gun in a slot in the back, pulling the trigger as the robot opened it's chest, revealing missiles and lasers that fired at all of the the monsters destroying all of them. He turned around.

"Wing Knight and Onyx right?" He asked us.

"Who are you?" I asked him.

"Well, the name is Jordan but you..." He began reverting to normal. "...can call me Kamen rider Torque."
114.title: Ambush and Rescue

choices: Mystic Knights of Tir Na Nog
12.content: I looked over my computer, which was displaying a folder containing episodes of all sorts of TV shows, including all Power Rangers series, Beetleborgs (including metallics), Mystic Knights of Tir Na Nog, Masked Rider, and Kamen Rider Dragon Knight. I looked through all the files and decided I would enter one of the files of...
12.title: Go into a show

121.content:
I looked at the folders I had set up for the Power Rangers series. Seventeen different series had been produced, so I had to lower the amount of series down a little.

I guided the arrow at one of the folders and opened the folder of the...
121.title: Power Rangers

1211.content: Finally, I choose a specific series, that being...
1211.title: Zordon era (MMPR-Space)

12111.content:
A few seconds after the Mighty Morphin Power Rangers folder is opened, a file automaticly opened up showing the first team of six rangers fighting a monster in the standerd quarry setting.

"That monster looks familliar" I noted, as both Jason and Billy were smacked away by the monster, then I realized that the monster that they were fighting was one of the generic mirror monsters from later on in the series. Why it was there was beyond me but I knew that it wasn't intended to be there. 'I've got to help them.' I thought, then I looked at my hands, or more specificly, the Onyx Advent deck. Turning to face my wall mounted mirror, I thrusted the advent deck towards the mirror, causing energy to course down from the deck and summon the rider belt. "Kamen Rider!" I announced, sliding the deck into the belt buckle, causing the black tinted energy field to surround me, filling me with tremendous power, the suit materialising in the process. I looked at the computer and dove into the world of Power Rangers.

(To make it much easier for myself, the story is going to switch from first person to thrid person perspective)

As the rangers fought against the strange monster, Tommy noticed a multicoloured circle appear in the sky.

"Great, just when this couldn't get any worse." He muttered, preparing to fight what came out of the portal.

When a figure in black dragon like armour appeared with a loud thud as he hit the ground, the rangers and the mirror monster all looked at what was causing the commotion. As Onyx brushed himself off from the dusty landing, he noticed the stares he was reciving. "What? Never seen a hero before?" He asked, rushing at the mirror monster. Unfortionately the ranger misinterperate this as him rushing at them, meaning Onyx was constantly ducking, jumping and dodging attempted blows from the rangers' weapons.

"Hey I'm on your side guys!" Onyx shouted. "Let me get to that monster!" After shouting the last part, Onyx lept into the air, pulling out a card from his Advent Deck, sliding it into the Black Drag Visor.

"Strike Vent." The visor announced, a Black Dragon's Head-like weapon attatching to Onyx's right arm. Still in mid air, Onyx let out a gigantiic burst of black flame as he approached the mirror monster, bathing it in the fire as the monster started rolling on the ground from the heat. Landing behind the monster Onyx glanced back at the rangers, the monster stumbling to it's feet.

"Are you guys going to finish him off or what?" He asked.

"I don't think that is required." Billy said. "Look!"

All of the heros looked at the monster, which fell over in pain from the damage delivered by the Strike Vent, exploding. Onyx dusted his hands well "Well that's the end of that then." He said, when suddenly...
12111.title: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers+Onyx

choices: Epic Onyx vs Dragon Knight fight, interupted by Rita or another Kamen Rider
We see how Dragon Knight obtained his deck and saw Anthony in the show
121111.content:
The point of view can be switched at any time, but since Onyx is supposed to be me, I will write in first person point of view while Onyx is around, although I won't put choices in first person. If something happens that Onyx doesn't know about, such as a rider pulling out a card that Onyx doesn't know what is, I will put it in parentheses (unless for the instance of the card, it is slotted that chapter).

I had just finished destroying the monster, and I was glad that the rangers finally realized I was one of the good guys when I heard a familiar sound.

"Strike Vent." Another visor announced, and I got hit from by a gigantic burst of fire from above, knocking me down. I got up and looked around to see where my attacker (Who I knew to be Dragon Knight because of the fire) was.

"Onyx! Prepare to be vented." A voice shouted. I looked towards it and saw Dragon Knight getting up from a crouch.

"Dragon Knight, what are you doing?!" I asked. "We're supposed to be on the same side!"

"You can't fool me, I know you're evil!" Dragon Knight said as the pulled out another card (The Sword Vent card).

"I don't want to fight you, but if you attack me, I'll have no choice." I replied as I pulled out my Sword Vent card. The rangers looked on, confused.

What happens next?
121111.title: Enter Dragon Knight

choices: Hang out with his childhood heroes, the Power Rangers
1211111.content:
(Epic fight? So calling this)

As the two riders circle each other, the rangers looked on, confused on whose side they should fight on.

"Hey Jason, what should we do?" Zack asked.

"I don't know Zack." Jason admitted. "The guy he called Dragon Knight says the guy who just helped us is evil, but could that be true?"

Kimberly shook her head. "For all we know the guy in red could be a minion of Rita's sent to destroy him, then us." She pointed out.

"But we have no prior acknowledgement that the black armoured warrior is truly assign to fight with us or if he has been sent to destroy us." Billy replied.

"Translation Trini?" Jason asked.

"He say we don't know if this Onyx is on our side or not." Trini translated from Billy's more complex sentence. "and I agree with him, I think we should wait this out."

Tommy looked between the two fighters. "Well if we intervene or not, this is going to be a powerful fight." He pointed out, as the two Dragon Kamen Riders charged at each other, swords clashing loudly as they collided. Soon enough, both of them were trading blows with their swords, creating a storm of sword blows which would be countered in turn by the opposing rider.

"Why are you trying to fight me? I just saved the rangers!" Onyx said, sidestepping a sword strike

"Don't make me laugh, even Adam couldn't get away with that one in the show." Dragon Knight retorted, stepping back to avoide one of Onyx's strikes. "You save good guys in order to gain their trust and then when their back is turned you backstab them." He explained, both of the riders' swords currently locked against one another.

"While that's good reasoning, you don't even know me!" Onyx pointed out. "At least the good guys had a reason to be suspicious with Adam, they knew what he had done. Your basis that I'm evil is because I'm using a deck that's supposed to be darker than the others!" He added, drawing a card from his deck and sliding it into the Black Drag Visor, Dragon Knight quickly copying him with the Drag Visor

"FINAL VENT." The visors simountaniously announced, the twin dragon Advent Beasts appearing on the field. However as each of the rider prepared to leap into the air and finish the vent, Onyx noted something was flying towards the ground - one of Rita's wands.

"GET DOWN!" He yelled, then looked at Dragblacker and pointed at the rangers.

Spotting the wand Dragon Knight pulled a card from his deck and slid it into his visor. "Take cover!" He shouted.

"Gaurd Vent." Twin gaurds appeared on Dragon Knight's arms, when he realised Dragblacker was protectively coiling around the rangers. The earth started shaking as the wand caused the mirror monster to rematerialise and grow. As it did, energy coursed out of the evil wand, firing off bolts of energy in random directions. Dragon Knight noticed that any near the rangers deflected off of Dragblacker.

"And I thought he was ugly before." Tommy remarked.

"Ok guys, we need-" Jason started, when Goldar and a large group of Putties appeared.

"Not this time red ranger, no zords." Goldar announced.

Onyx gulped as he watched the monster walk off while the ranger were engaged in a battle with the putties and Goldar, Dragblacker having returned to the mirror world. Even if he summoned Dragblacker or was in a survive mode, he couldn't take down a giant mirror monster.

"Hey" Dragon Knight shouted. "Normally I'd finish our fight, but I have more pressing matters." He said, pulling out a card from the deck.

"Attack Vent." The visor announced, Dragredder appearing but then growing to be much larger than before. Suddenly Dragon Knight leapt inside Dragreder.

"Contract Beasts can become zords here, if you wanted to help!" Dragon Knight stated.

Onyx, slightly surprised by this turn of events and that Dragon Knight gave him some advice, pulled out his Attack Vent card and slid it into the visor.

"Attack Vent." Dragblacker, who growed to be larger than before, flew in front of Onyx, allowing him to board the contract zord. Both Dragblacker and Dragredder took to the skies, shooting off several fireballs at the retreating Mirror Monster. Dragredder flew past the monster,smacking it back towards the battlefield with it's tail. Dragblacker let out a stream of flame at the monster. The Mirror Monster turned and swiped at Dragblacker, which was barely knocked away by Dragredder which took the hit.

"Why did you just help me?" Onyx asked, Dragblacker ascending to a higher altitude and out of the monsters range. "You were trying to vent me a little bit ago."

Dragon Knight chuckled. "Firstly, I wouldn't be much of a hero if I didn't help people and secondly, I owed you for protecting the rangers, twice." He pointed out, Dragredder accompanying Dragblacker (Music start-Mighty Morphin power rangers short version). "So, ready to finish this like we tried to before?" He asked, pulling out a Final Vent card,

"Only if you aim for him and not me." Onyx joked, also pulling out a Final Vent card.

"FINAL VENT." Both visors announced as the riders slid the cards inside. Both rider lept out of their zords, who summoned energy to hold the monster in place, Both dragons let out a combined blast of fire, propelling both riders towards the monster feet first.

"Double Rider Kick!" Both riders announced, managing to kick their way straight through the monster, causing it to explode.

Goldar, being the only one left of Rita's strike force, glared. "You win this round rangers, but we'll be back." He said, teleporting away. Both of the riders, now without their zords, landed next to the rangers.

"So, now the monster's gone, what are you going to do?" Onyx asked Dragon Knight. For a few second the tension in the area was thick enough to cut with a knife, the rangers each prepared incase another fight broke out.

Dragon Knight chuckled lightly. "I think your trustworthy enough, you did help save the day, but don't give me a reason not to trust you." He said, then turned to the rangers. "Now, what to do with these guys?"

"We can't erase their memories, Rita's bunch would still remember anyway." Onyx pointed out.

"Point." Dragon Knight coceeded "What about a memory blocker?"

"Same problem." Billy pointed out. "Rita would ineveitibley use that knowledge against us in order to try and defeat us."

"How about we just keep this a secret between us heroes, that way there are none of the cons of the other ways?" Tommy asked.

"And we could let you guys know if other people like that monster or you show up." Kimberly added.

Onyx nodded. "Sounds like a good idea." He said.

"I agree." Dragon Knight said, a grey square portal which shifted as if the surface was water appearing next to him. "Well, later rangers, later Ryuga." He said, the portal sweeping across him.

"Ryuga?" Onyx questioned, but then shook his head as he decided on what to do next.
1211111.title: Epic Onyx vs Dragon Knight fight, but interupted

1211112.content:
Unknown to Onyx and the rangers, the reason behind Dragon Knight's attack was actually due to recent events in his life. Dark events.

+++Earlier that morning+++

Leon smiled as he watched the latest episode of the subtitled japanese Kamen Riders, the glow from his laptop lighting up the face of the young adult. This was a common occurence with Leon, even though it was early morning he still enjoyed watching the episodes. His room, being rather plain at first glance, was decorated with nurmerous toy transformation belts from different series.

As he finished watching the show, he yawned and curled up, ready to get some more sleep, he heard the sounds of a fire being ignited. Quickly getting out of his bed, he opened up his door and was immediatly blasted back by a burst of heat, knocking him unconsious as he hit the opposite wall.

When Leon woke up, he noticed that, aside from his room, the entire house looked like it had been shined... but neither of his parents, nor his sister he later found out, were there. "Where are they?" Leon wondered, walking around the strangely clean house.

"The Advent Void" An echoing, female voice said, appearing to come from all directions at once. "They were vented by one of the Kamen Riders. If you are to return them, you first find out who was the one who vented them. The Advent Deck that you need is in front of you, along with everything you need to know."

Leon, still slightly in shock, grabbed the deck and suddenly gained his rider knowledge. Glancing around he noticed that an episode of Power Rangers was playing in on his laptop screen, despite the fact that he hadn't been watching that, with the Power Rangers and Kamen Rider Onyx fighting a mirror monster. Growling in anger, Leon thrusted the deck out. "Onyx has a dragon, so he's a prime candidate!" He said, thrusting out his Advent Deck, the belt materialising onto him. Quickly contemplating weather to use the japanese or english transformation phrases, he glanced at the battle. "If I'm Dragon Knight, then I guess it's... Kamen Rider!" He shouted in rage, placing the Advent Deck into the belt, materialising his suit within the energy field. As he dove into the show, Dragon Knight took out the Strike Vent card...

+++Present Time+++

"Tell me why you vented my family Onyx, and I shall make your punishment swift!" Leon said, now caught up in a mix of battle frenzy and revenge frenzy.

Anthony, now pinned to the ground shifted his helmet to the side in a confused manner "I have no idea what you're talking about!" He shouted "You're attacking me for no reason!" He then kicked Leon off of him.

"Won't confess?" Leon asked, a malicous glow in his eyes, although it couldn't be seen. "Then I'll have to vent you to save them!" He said, raising his sword up high.

"Not if we have anything to say about it!" Jason shouted. "Rangers blade blasters up!" The girls backflipped onto Jason, Billy and Zack's shoulders, forming a sort of human pyramid. Each pointed a blade blaster towards the center of their formation.

"Fire!" They shouted, blasting Leon away from Anthony. As they did though, a white glow blazed from the Dragon Knight Advent Deck, releasing a giant monster version of Dragon Knight.

Leon, recovering from the blast, noticed the monster. "What the hell is that?" He asked, the monsters 'eyes' being white.

"Knowing the logic in these shows, a monster possessing you." Anthony said, rushing over to Leon. "You ok?"

"Yeah, but this doesn't add up, it was influencing me at best because I really thought you had done it!" Leon explained, getting back on his feet.

"Your realisation and the guys blasting you must have broken the spell the monster had on you." Tommy explained, the other rangers calling the Dinozords to combat the monster.

Leon looked at Anthony. "Sorry about that, I'll explain about that outburst little later." He said. "But right now I have some unfinished business to deal with." He said, pulling out his Survive Mode card.

"You and me both." Anthony said, pulling out the same card. They slotted the cards as Tommy played the dragon dagger, summoning the Dragonzord alongside the Megazord.

"Survive Mode!" Both of the visors announced, transforming into their survive forms. Both pulled out and slotted their Attack Vent cards. "Attack Vent." The Advent Beasts turned into Zords, which Anthony and Leon entered. They then pulled out and slotted their Final Vent cards. "Final Vent!" Dragblazer and Dragranzer roared and went to opposite sides of what Anthony and Leon dubbed "Fake Knight." Both Survive Mode Advent Beasts turned into motorcycle forms while blasting Fake Knight with balls of fire, before crashing down on it, causing it to explode.

As the dust cleared from the explosion, the monster had dissapeared, the two riders now congratulated each other as they prepared to return to either one's home for Leon's explanation.
1211112.title: Dark Origins: Dragon Knight

choices: While Anthony eats his breakfast, Leon takes a look around the mirror world
12111122.content:
--Leon's POV--

As I watched the surroundings of the generic battlefield of the power rangers disappear behind me, I noticed us reappearing in a place I wasn't familiar with. "I'll take a wild guess in that we're at your house?" I asked, both of us emerging into the real world but still in our rider suits.

"Yeah." Onyx said, turning off the TV. "I thought this would be a perfect place to discuss things." He added, de-transforming into a young adult "My name's Anthony, yours?"

--General POV--

"My name is Leon. You'll excuse me if I don't de-henshin, but the suit is a good disguise if someone manages to spot us." Leon said.

"De-what now?" Anthony asked.

Leon nervously chuckled. "Whoops, sorry. Henshin is a japanese word which means transform." He explained.

"Why did you use it then?" Anthony asked.

"Instead of saying 'Kamen Rider,' the majority of japanese Riders say 'henshin.'"

"Ok, that makes a little more sense then." Anthony said. "Next point, why did you blame me for your family being gone?"

Leon sighed, rubbing the back of his neck. "I should have seen this as a trap from the start, but here goes. I woke up this morning, after being knocked out by the heat of a strong fire, to find the house devoid of all human life, aside from me." He said. "Then a mysterious voice told me a rider vented them, so in my rage I saw you and assumed you as a major suspect, given that you have a dragon."

Anthony gave Leon a wierd look. "But if you know so much about riders, then why didn't you know that human's without powers aren't vented?" Anthony pointed out.

"They aren't?" Leon asked. "I don't watch as much Dragon Knight as I do the japanese shows, so I don't know much on the venting."

Anthony nodded. "Yep, you were conned." He said, then somone knocked on the door. Leon quickly leapt back into the mirror world, as a girl with curly brown hair entered the room.

"Hey Scottie, are you going to get some breakfast or what?" She asked.

"Yes Chrisy, just give me a second." Anthony said, closing the door as Christina walked off. Turning to the TV, he noticed Leon was rolling around on the floor having silenced the audo link in the helmet. "What's so funny?"

Leon got back on his feet, turning the helmet back on. "Beam me up Scottie!" he cried out dramaticly, before silencing the link again, hiding the sound of his laughter, Anthony shaking his head as he headed to the kitchen.
12111122.title: Anthony's house

121111221.content:
Leon, not one to stay in one place without something to do, decided to take a wander around the mirror world outside of Anthony's house. Mentally, he was dissapointed that he had fallen for such an easy trick, one that made him feel a bit shameful to be wearing the armour. Suddenly he leapt back, dodging a blast of flame. Looking around for the source, he spotted a white mechanical dragon, one that resembled Dragredder and Dragblacker in appearence. Leaping into the air to avoid another blast of fire, Leon landed and took cover behind a stone bench.

'A white dragon beast? I know that's never appeared before!' He thought, quickly drawing two cards out of his deck. Suddenly, he felt the cover start to heat up a bit, then leapt away in fright when he saw that the fire was melting the stone! "I don't care what you are." Leon said. "You're going down!" Upon declaring this, he slid both of the cards into the visor, one by one, activating them when needed.

"Attack Vent. Guard Vent." The visor annouced as Dragredder arrived, blasting it's white counterpart as Leon quickly used his new guards to block the flames.

--

Anthony, having finished breakfast, was looking around for the fellow Dragon rider, having not spotted him in the mirrors. Suddenly, he heard the mirror world sound, the one made whenever a person went into our out of the mirror world.

Quickly thrusting his deck out, he calmly said "Kamen Rider." transforming, and then leaping through a nearby window. He immediatly saw what the problem was, Leon was surrounded by three Gelenewts, who weren't giving him any chance to recover from their attacks, while Dragredder was tangling with a white version of itself. Anthony sighed, charging towards the Gelenewts.

"Sword Vent." His visor announced, having recieved the first card Kit ever uses in a fight as soon as Anthony had started to charge, allowing him to vent one of the monsters while they were off guard.

"Can't leave you alone without you getting into trouble huh?" Anthony asked, Narrowly dodging a strike from one of the Gelenewts' giant shuriken. The Gelenewt then feeling just how strong a Guard Vent is as Leon stuck it across the back of the head.

"You were saying?" Leon asked.

The two then heard a slightly distorted visor announce "Attack Vent." As a chameleon appeared on the scene, striking both of the riders with its fast tounge. This wasn't hat surprised the riders, what surprised them was the fact that a female dragon themed rider, looking similar to Blank Knight from the series, except white and with feminine armor, had appeared alongside it.

"Hello riders." Blank Knight said. Leon was shocked, the voice was the same as the one who had informed him before.

"You!" Leon shouted, suddenly able to find his voice. "You sent me after Onyx to vent him didn't you?!"

The Blank Knight ignored the question, aslowly approaching the two riders as Dragblanker, as the two riders had dubbed it, disengaged from Dragredder and curled around it's master protectively "I think that this chameleon Advent Beast belonged to another person close to you, his yelps of pain were good enough to drown out the obnioxious sword clanging and fireball blasting." She said.

Leon growled. "What did you do to Mitch?" He asked.

Blank Knight laughed. "Oh don't worry, you'll both be joining him soon enough." She said, taking out and sliding in a card

"Final Vent!" The visor announced.

As Blank Knight leapt into the air, Leon suddenly realized that she'd target Anthony first, not him "Move!" Leon shouted, quickly sliding in his own card.

"Final Vent!"

Leon quickly ran at Blank Knight, Dragredder coming at a different angle than usual. When Blank Knight flew toward Anothony, covered in flames, Dragredder propelled Leon towards the female rider. The resulting collision was enough to knock Anthony backwards into a set of nearby trees. As the smoke cleared, Leon landed roughly on the ground, while Blank Knight landed gracefully.

"So easy to minipulate, little dragon." Blank Knight said. "I knew you'd take the blow for him." As she finished speaking, Leon's form started to dissolve.

"No..." Leon said, disbelieving. "I can't be done... not yet!" He said, struggling to get up, but failing, With one last try he managed to push himself up onto his feet, then looked at Anthony "Beam me up Scotty." Leon said with a final defiant laugh before being vented fully.

Anthony, quickly shaking himself out of the shock, growled at the female rider. "You witch!" He shouted, drawing a card from his deck.

"Don't worry, you'll be seeing him soon." Blank Knight said, drawing out another Final Vent card.

"Survive Mode!" Anthony's visor announced after changing forms and having the card slotted.

"Final Vent" Blank Knight's visor announced. She had her feet wrapped around by the chameleon beast's long tongue, which then swung her upside down towards a rapidly heating up Survive Mode Onyx. The tounge retreating just before colision, both of the riders spun in the air, until finally Anthony landed headfirst and Blank Knight was on top.

"Too easy." She said, walking away.

"Final Vent!" She heard a visor say behind her. Quickly spinning around in shock, Blank Knight noticed that the Final Vent hadn't done enough damage as the obsidian armoured rider rode towards her, his black draconic steed blasting black fireballs at her. Seeing no other way out, Blank Knight leapt into a mirror. When Anthony saw that no one else was left, he disembarked Dragblazer, detransforming back to normal as he was left to experience what he thought was a hollow victory.
121111221.title: While Anthony eats his breakfast, Leon takes a ...

1211112211.content:
Leon woke up sometime later with a massive headache. "Ugh what happened?" He wondered out loud. He looked around at his surroundings and freaked out, remembering what happened. "Holy crap, I'm in the Advent Void!" He yelled. he would have continued to panic if his deck didn't give him the knowledge of the time limit until he would be ejected from the Advent Void.

"Okay, well, that isn't too bad." He continued to talk to himself. "I might as well look around." Floating around the for a couple of minutes he noticed a weird looking pod with a view hole. Floating over to It he saw a very familier face. "Mitch!" Leon yelled as saw his friend in an unconscious state. He pressed a button to open the pod releasing, his friend who fell forward and turned into a ball of light. Leon the continued to search around until time ran out, and they were then ejected from the Advent Void.

Where do they arrive?
1211112211.title: Wake up call Advent Void

12111122112.content:
It had been a couple of days since the incident with Blank Knight, and Anthony was in a tight spot. Randy, Josh, and Brianna were with him. "This shouldn't be happening." He said. "How are we getting our butts kicked so badly!?"

"Don't worry, everything will be ok." Brianna said, putting a hand on his shoulder.

"How will everything be ok?!" Randy shouted in anger. "Everyone has been vented except for us, and Blank Knight has enslaved most of them, including my little brother and Anthony's sister! I swear, when I get a hold of her, she's getting a one way trip to the Advent Void!"

"Shouldn't I be the one who's making the vengence speach?" Leon said, causing the other riders to turn towards him, with Anthony having a look of shock. "After all, I was the one it happened to,"

"Leon!" He exclaimed going over to his friend. "How'd you get out of the Advent Void?"

"Well after I was vented, I woke up, and my deck told me that If you or I get vented, we'll wake up after a certain point, and then be ejected a little bit after, but while we are in, we can save up to two other riders,

"Well it's good to have you back, Leon, and if you don't mind me asking who's your friend?" Anthony said noticing the other man in the room.

"This is my friend Mitch." Leon answered. "He's Kamen Rider Camo/Verde. Who are your friends?"

"It's nice to meet you Mitch." Anthony said, nodding towards him.

"Same to you," Mitch replied.

"As for the others, these are my friends Randy, Josh, and Brianna." Anthony replied. "Josh and Randy have been my best friends for years, and I met Brianna not long after you were vented. Randy is Axe, Josh is Wrath, and Brianna is Shade."

"Shade? I've never heard of a Shade." Leon said.

"Until now, neither had I." Anthony replied. "She's a black version of Siren."

Anthony, Josh, Randy, and Brianna began filling in Leon and Mitch about what's happened since Leon was vented, until...
12111122112.title: Reunion at Anthony's house

choices: Let the Battle with Blank Knight's forces begin
121111221121.content:
Blank Knight appeared in a mirror with Kamen Riders Strike, Spear, Siren, Sting, Torque, Thrust, Insisor, and Abyss, who were all under her command, ready for battle.

The free riders powered up and went into the mirror to confront them. The battle started and the team divided the enemy. Anthony took on his friend Robert (Thrust) and Steven (Abyss), Leonite fought Diego (Strike) and Jordan (Torque), Randy against his own brother Evan (Spear), Josh against Leon (Sting), Mitch went for Greg (Insisor), and Brianna battled Christina (Siren), while Blank Knight stepped back to watch the battle.
121111221121.title: Calm before the storm

choices: A couple of riders from Scifiwizard's story appear
The characters from Kamen Rider Decade arrive in this world
1211112211212.title: Something unexpected happens

12111122112121.content:
-Anthony's point of view-

While being forced to fight my comrades, I noticed that two other riders had reached the battle. However, upon seeing who they were, I was stunned, almost to the point of dropping my guard.

'What the!?!' I thought, shaken. "Wing Knight is back... with a second Kamen Rider Spear!?!"

It seemed impossible, but yet, there they were. Unfortunately, I did not have the time to investigate as Thrust and Abyss continued their attack and the fight continued...

-Eric's point of view-

Upon entering the world beyond the mirror, Jeff and I were greeted by a number of Kamen Riders in a free for all battle against each other as if they had all gone suddenly mad. Then, we spotted a second Kamen Rider Spear..

"What the!?!" Jeff said out loud. "I'm no expert in the series but I'm sure there was only one Spear."

Wondering that myself, I noticed one female Kamen Rider I did not recognize from the series, watching the entire fight. My gut instincts were screaming to me that, who ever she was, she was controlling the fight.

"Do your best to try to break this up." I said. "Distract them somehow, if you can."

"What will you be doing?" Jeff asked, summoning his spear.

"There's a female Rider watching this fight." I replied. "I think she's forcing this fight, somehow. If I can throw off her concentration long enough..."

Jeff nodded, seeing your logic, though he sensed it was not the whole story.

"Just watch your left flank!" He warned as I ran into the fight. "Don't let your guard down!"

I knew Jeff was right but I had no time to argue with him, action was called for! I moved quickly through the battle, trying to reach the woman Rider unnoticed but to my disappointment, she saw me just as I broke from the crowd.

"WHAT!?!" came her response, taking a defensive stance.

"Surprised!?!" I yelled, charging her.

"SWORD VENT!" The visor announced.
12111122112121.title: What the!?!...

choices: The fight (Blank Knight's point of view.)
121111221121211.content:
Eric's point of view-

With my sword ready, I charged the unknown Rider at full speed then did a foot ball dodging move as she responded with a sword of her own after slotting the card quickly and grabbing it. I had hoped to throw her off balance with some foot work, making her think I was coming in from another angle but she did not fall for it. I brought my blade down towards her left shoulder and, as I predicted, she blocked my blow with ease. However, I was only using half strength so to judge her own physical power. Only her stance, bracing against my blow, gave nothing away.

"Stop this fight!" I demanded, trying to sound authoritative. "NOW!"

"What if I don't?" The rider asked calmly.

"I'll make you stop it!" I replied coldly, pushing my blade closer to make my point. "These are fellow riders!"

"You've definately never watched Kamen Rider Ryuki, it is completely about a war between all riders, with only a couple not fighting the others, and in Dragon Knight, almost all of the Earth riders are fighting against the rest Ventaran riders, along with the Earth Dragon Knight and Sting." She said mockingly. "Now, let's see what you've got!" The rider said, pushing me away from her.

The unknown woman was surprisingly strong but I managed not to stumble and blocked a swing from her sword. Only, that was the first of a series of blows as she seemed to come at me full out from the start. "This fight is pointless!" I called to her, still forced to be on the defensive. "End it!"

"I agree, this is pointless." The rider fired back. "You're hardly a match for me. Step off and I might be easy on you!"

"I never back down!" I replied, charging into an offensive of powerful swings.

"Pity." The rider said, blocking my attacks.

With surprising skill, the rider used her sword to knock my own out of my hand, causing it to hit the floor with a hollow clang, out of my reach. I was stunned but, fortunately, the mask hid my expression.

"Last chance." The rider said, calmly, pointing her sword at my heart. "Surrender to me."

There was no time, in my mind, to summon another weapon as I was sure she would not give me the time draw out my Black Visor to slot the cards in it, thus I wouldn't be able to use it either. Instead, I impulsively pushed her sword aside with one arm and physically charged her, planting my best right hook onto her jaw before she could react. The rider's head jolted back from the blow as I then struck her arm, barely forcing her to drop her own sword. The rider turned her head back to me but uttered only one word...

"Stubborn."
121111221121211.title: Wing Knight vs Blank Knight.

choices: Anthony knocks his opponents away and joins in the fight
1211112211212111.content:
-See the title-

I saw Wing Knight charging at me with his Sword Vent. I decided to leave the question about how he escaped until after I sent him back to the Advent Void. I slotted my Sword Vent card.

"Sword Vent!" My visor annouced as my sword appeared and landed in my hand. I slashed at him, but he dodged like a football player with the ball would do if someone was charging at him. He performed some fancy footwork to make it look like he was coming from another angle, obivously to throw me off balance, but I wasn't foolish enough to fall for it. He brought his blade down towards my left shoulder, but I blocked his blow with ease. I knew he was stronger than that, and he knew how good I was, so I couldn't figure out why he was holding back, but like the rest of what was happening, I decided to think about it later.

"Stop this fight!" He demanded, obviously trying to sound authoritative. "NOW!" I noticed his voice sounded different, like he was younger, but I once again ignored it for the moment

"What if I don't?" I asked calmly.

"I'll make you stop it!" He replied coldly, pushing his blade closer to make his point. "These are fellow riders!" I was really getting confused, he should have known I didn't care, he'd tried this before
